asset.notes: nurse's bag contained her diary of names and addresses of patients requiring visits over the last six months along with some access details.  Following enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Personally owned.

confidentiality.notes: nurse's bag contained her diary of names and addresses of patients requiring visits over the last six months along with some access details (addresses, where they keep keys to get into home, etc).

discovery_notes: A Cambridgeshire police spokesman confirmed they were called at 11.55pm to reports of theft from a vehicle in Bourne Road in Cambridge.  "A bag was stolen from the vehicle as a result of the incident," he said. "The theft is believed to have taken place between 11.40pm and 11.55pm."
summary: Patients warned of 'shocking' data breach after nurse's bag stolen from car in Cambridge  An out of hours car, used by a community nurse with Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust (CPFT), was broken into on July 9 while parked outside a patient's home in east Chesterton at 11.50pm.  The trust has now written to all 200 patients affected after the nurse's bag contained her diary of names and addresses of patients requiring visits over the last six months along with some access details.

victim.victim_id: Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust
